text: Ah, the guest of honor.
Welcome to the bridge of the Thaliak.
Yes, I was named after a ship.
No, it's not the other way around.
Thaliak does an oooh big stretchy and then leans on a railing.
Suppose it's time for more exposition.
Alright, so, first trip is the Sagittarius Hub.
It's basically a waypoint for traveling around the galaxy.

If you REALLY want to know, we point our ship in the deadly radioactive soup above the supermassive black hole in the center of the galaxy that powers the hub, since that's a pretty easy target from anywhere in the galaxy,
and then, from there, you can shoot your ship to most anywhere in the galaxy.
It's like a diving board, but you can jump really far and control where you jump.
Shockingly simple, you know, once you understand the subatomic warp rift amplifiers and all that.
The coffee there is bland but it's on the way and it's cheap.
So, let me know when you're good and we're off.
This whole thing might take one Earth day, really.
Thaliak leans over the console and presses some buttons.
They mumble to themselves. You can't really make out what they say except for one thing.
Maybe this work week might be easier than I thought.
Travel is real easy, it'll be even smoother than a cruise liner.
Thaliak pushes a button, which creates a giant terrifying...thing in front of the ship.
You don't have time to muster a scream before the ship passes through without incident.
